text: Hans van Breukelen (born 4 October 1956) is a former Dutch football player. He has played for Netherlands national team. == Career statistics == === Club === Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League ContinentalIncludes European Cup, Champions League, UEFA Cup Winners' Cup and UEFA Cup Apps Goals Apps Goals FC Utrecht 1976–77 1 0 1977–78 6 0 1978–79 32 0 1979–80 34 0 1980–81 34 0 4 0 1981–82 33 0 2 0 1982–83 2 0 Total 142 0 6 0 Nottingham Forest 1982–83 25 0 1983–84 36 0 8 0 Total 61 0 8 0 PSV Eindhoven 1984–85 32 0 4 0 1985–86 34 0 4 0 1986–87 33 0 2 0 1987–88 33 0 9 0 1988–89 22 0 2 0 1989–90 32 0 6 0 1990–91 32 0 2 0 1991–92 32 0 4 0 1992–93 25 0 9 0 1993–94 33 0 2 0 Total 308 0 46 0 Career total 511 0 58 0 === International === Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals Netherlands 1980 1 0 1981 3 0 1982 5 0 1983 2 0 1984 3 0 1985 6 0 1986 6 0 1987 7 0 1988 10 0 1989 5 0 1990 12 0 1991 5 0 1992 8 0 Total 73 == Honours == PSV Eindhoven * Eredivisie (6): 1985–86, 1986–87, 1987–88, 1988–89, 1990–91, 1991–92 * KNVB Cup: 1987–88, 1988–89, 1989–90 * Dutch Super Cup: 1992 * European Cup: 1987–88 Netherlands * UEFA European Championship: 1988. Individual * Dutch Goalkeeper of the Year: 1987, 1988, 1991, 1992. * UEFA European Championship Team of the Tournament: 1988 * IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper: Silver ball 1988 * IFFHS World's Best Goalkeeper: Bronze ball 1992 ==References== Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch association football goalkeepers Category:Sportspeople from Utrecht (city) Category:Netherlands at UEFA Euro 1988 Category:Netherlands at the 1990 FIFA World Cup Category:Netherlands at UEFA Euro 1992 Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players Category:1990 FIFA World Cup players Category:UEFA European Championship-winning players
title: Hans van Breukelen
